For the koftas: salt and freshly ground black pepper.
For the mash: ½ sweet potato, peeled and finely chopped
½ carrot, peeled and finely chopped
salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps: To make the koftas, place the pork, dried chilli flakes, the spices and soy sauce into a food processor and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Divide the mixture into three equal portions and roll each into sausage-shaped koftas. Skewer the koftas onto wooden skewers and rub with the olive oil.
Place an ovenproof frying pan over a medium heat. Add the koftas and fry, turning occasionally, until browned on all sides. Transfer to the oven and bake for five minutes, or until cooked through.

To make the mash, place the sweet potato and carrot into a saucepan of boiling water and boil until soft. Drain the saucepan of water, add the butter and mash the carrot and sweet potato, seasoning, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper
To serve, place the carrot and sweet potato mash onto a warm plate and place the koftas on top.
title: Spicy pork koftas with sweet potato and carrot mash
